q: Simon Cowell has made no secret of the fact that he was underwhelmed by what Dublin had to offer- and it is believed to be under his orders that X Factor has axed the Irish leg. There is only so many places we can go on the audition trail, an insider revealed. "We went to Dublin last year but we haven't been to Liverpool so we thought we should do that this year." n't make a virtual omelet without getting a few eggheads scrambled. This clash of the tech titans is captured by POLITICO's Elizabeth Wasserman in a slice of the type of reporting you can expect from POLITICO Pro. Google is under siege in Washington like never before- and it says an "anti-Google industrial complex' is to blame. In an interview with POLITICO, a Google spokesman argued that a cabal of antitrust lawyers, lobbyists and public relations firms is conspiring against the Internet search giant. The mastermind? Google says it's Microsoft, Wasserman reports. "Maybe it's irony, or maybe it"s payback. In a blog posting, Eric Schmidt wrote, as Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated, noting that Google recognized a need to "speed up decision making." Now, all his victims are the actual superstars. I've got one of the real superstars sitting beside me.
